intro: Lasianthus velutinus, commonly known as the velvet leaved lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
